sections.title: Administrative Information
sections.content:
Patient Full Name: Not available
Date of Birth (Age in years): 58 years
Sex: Female

sections.title: Introduction + Summary of Care
sections.content:
Dear Dr. X, thank you for reviewing patient, a 58 year old female to be discharged on [Discharge Date] from [Department] at [Facility]. The summary of their presentation and condition is documented below.
- Principal diagnosis: Acute knee pain.
- Reason for presentation: The patient presented with a <CIT id="c1">two-month history of knee pain</CIT> that <CIT id="c1">acutely commenced during a yoga session</CIT> while her <CIT id="c1">knee and hip were flexed on the ground</CIT>. Initially, the pain was <CIT id="c2">10/10</CIT>, described as feeling <CIT id="c2">"broken"</CIT>, and made it <CIT id="c2">difficult to walk</CIT>. She <CIT id="c3">sought care at an acute care clinic</CIT> immediately after the incident.
- Secondary diagnoses: Chronic wrist pain.
- Additional complications: No additional complications were noted during this presentation.
- Past medical history: Significant past medical history includes <CIT id="c7">chronic wrist pain, for which she has received two steroid injections</CIT>, and she is <CIT id="c8">perimenopausal</CIT>.
- Summary of salient points of the patient care:
- The patient was initially assessed in an <CIT id="c3">acute care clinic</CIT> following the onset of symptoms.
- <CIT id="c4">Knee X-rays performed at the time showed no findings</CIT>.
- She was <CIT id="c4">provided with crutches</CIT> for ambulation.
- Currently, she reports <CIT id="c5">low pain levels</CIT> but still experiences <CIT id="c5">some pain while walking</CIT>.
- She has been managing her pain with <CIT id="c6">ibuprofen</CIT>.

citations.context: 58YO F with 2mth history of knee pain, occurring during a yoga session acutely while knee is flexed and hip flexed on the ground.
Pain feels like its "broken", difficult to walk, 10/10 pain, doesn't migrate.
After this, went straight to acute care clinic.
Ix: Knee XR had no findings, gave crunches and went home.
Now, has low pain, but still has some pain while walking.
She took ibuprofen for pain medication.
She also has chronic wrist pain, which has had 2x steroid shots.
She is perimenopausal, takes estrogen replacement and takes supplements (tumeric, glucosamine, evening primrose oil).

sections.title: Discharge Plan
sections.content:
- Follow up with General Practitioner for ongoing management of knee pain and review of chronic wrist pain.
- No specific follow-up pathology or labs are required at this time.
- No specific referrals to other services or specialists are required at this time.

sections.title: Issues List
sections.content:
- <CIT id="c9">Acute Knee Pain</CIT>: Onset <CIT id="c9">2 months prior during a yoga session</CIT> with <CIT id="c9">initial 10/10 pain</CIT>. <CIT id="c9">Knee X-ray was negative</CIT>. Currently, <CIT id="c9">pain is low but present with walking</CIT>.
- <CIT id="c10">Chronic Wrist Pain</CIT>: History of <CIT id="c10">two steroid injections</CIT>.
- <CIT id="c11">Perimenopausal</CIT>.

citations.context: 58YO F with 2mth history of knee pain, occurring during a yoga session acutely while knee is flexed and hip flexed on the ground. Pain feels like its "broken", difficult to walk, 10/10 pain, doesn't migrate. After this, went straight to acute care clinic. Ix: Knee XR had no findings, gave crunches and went home. Now, has low pain, but still has some pain while walking.
She also has chronic wrist pain, which has had 2x steroid shots.
She is perimenopausal, takes estrogen replacement and takes supplements (tumeric, glucosamine, evening primrose oil).

sections.title: Medications
sections.content:
New medications:
- No new medications were prescribed during this admission.

Changed medications:
- No changes were made to existing medications during this admission.

Unchanged medications:
- Estrogen replacement (details not specified)
- Glucosamine (details not specified)
- Ibuprofen oral as needed for pain (details not specified)
- Evening primrose oil (details not specified)
- Turmeric (details not specified)

Ceased medications:
- No medications were ceased during this admission.

citations.context: She took ibuprofen for pain medication.
She is perimenopausal, takes estrogen replacement and takes supplements (tumeric, glucosamine, evening primrose oil).

sections.title: Information Provided to the Patient
sections.content:
- Education was provided regarding activity modification and pain management strategies for her knee pain.
- The patient was advised to continue using ibuprofen as needed for pain relief.
- She was encouraged to follow up with her General Practitioner for ongoing assessment and management of both her knee and chronic wrist pain.
- The patient demonstrated a good understanding of the instructions and her current condition.
